text: This document specifies the requirements for the development of a “Smart House”, called DigitalHome (DH), by the DigitalHomeOwner Division of HomeOwner Inc.
There is a supplementary document that provides additional detail and information about the DigitalHome requirements: the Digital Home Use Case Model.
The Digital Home system, for the purposes of this document, is a system that will allow a home user to manage devices that control the environment of a home.

Requirements: manage devices
control the environment of a home

requirements reference: control the environment of a home

text: The development team will consist of five engineers.
The humidistat shall provide a “set point” humidity that is used to control humidifiers and dehumidifiers achieve the set point humidity.

Requirements: achieve the set point humidity

text: This section provides a description of the functional requirements.
Controller values can be sent to controllers to change the DigitalHome environment.

Requirements: to change the DigitalHome environment

text: Up to eight thermostats shall be placed in rooms throughout the home.
The system shall support Fahrenheit and Celsius temperature values.
The DigitalHome security system consists of contact sensors and a set security alarms.
Log in to an account shall require entry of an account name and a password.
The ASPERA-3 instrument package will be flown on the Mars Express mission of the European Space Agency (ESA) and will be launched in June 2003 according to the current schedule.
The first step in defining the IDFS data sets is to identify the physical instruments that make up the ASPERA-3 experiment and any ancillary data necessary for scientific analysis.
Each of the physical components will be divided into logical groups (called virtual instruments) in which each logical group will be formatted as an IDFS data set.
The requirements associated with the functionality of the APAF ground data system are itemized in the table below.
The APAF system shall acquire from ESOC the telemetry data of the ASPERA-3 Experiment and Mars Express Orbit/Attitude to automatically process the data on a daily basis.

Requirements: to automatically process the data
Shared Phenomena: the telemetry data of the ASPERA-3 Experiment and Mars Express Orbit/Attitude

interface: the telemetry data of the ASPERA-3 Experiment and Mars Express Orbit/Attitude
the telemetry data of the ASPERA-3 Experiment and Mars Express Orbit/Attitude

text: The APAF system shall process all ASPERA-3 science data into IDFS data sets.
The ASPERA-3 and MEX OA telemetry data shall be stored on a local SwRI archive for data availability and re-processing.

Requirements: data availability and re-processing
Shared Phenomena: The ASPERA-3 and MEX OA telemetry data

interface: The ASPERA-3 and MEX OA telemetry data

text: The requirement associated with the privacy of the APAF ground data system is in the table below.
The mnemonic, CR, is used in the requirement identifiers to show that these requirements are Computer resource Requirements.
There shall be a web server for the APAF system for web-based displays and information change.

Requirements: web-based displays and information change

text: There shall be a network connection between SwRI and NISN for data transfers and distribution.

Requirements: data transfers and distribution

text: SwRI shall provide APAF system maintenance.
ASPERA-3 and MEX OA IDFS data and any APAF-generated intermediate files of ASPERA-3 and MEX OA cleaned-up telemetry shall be provided to all ASPERA-3 Co-I's.

Shared Phenomena: ASPERA-3 and MEX OA IDFS data
ASPERA-3 and MEX OA cleaned-up telemetry

interface: ASPERA-3 and MEX OA IDFS data
ASPERA-3 and MEX OA cleaned-up telemetry
ASPERA-3 and MEX OA cleaned-up telemetry

Shared Phenomena: the ASPERA-3 and MEX OA data

text: The Space Fractions system is a learning tool created to help improve fraction-solving skills for sixth-grade students.

Requirements: help improve fraction-solving skills

text: Specific requirements and expectations regarding the components of the product are given in this portion of the SRS document.
Moreover, these students (as well as the teacher) are assumed to have basic computer and

The personas we will use to model our intended users are a sixth grade female student called Alice learning fractions who does not like to use computers, a sixth grade male student called Bobby learning fractions who is very competitive and a sixth grade teacher with computer skills called Claire.
Claire is a sixth grade teacher who has computer skills.

The Space Fractions system will have a series of fraction questions (testing arithmetic, equivalence, graphical interpretation, and improper versus proper fraction skills) that sequentially form a storyline related to the introduction.
The Space Fractions system will have an ending scene where the user's score is calculated and ranked, with an option to quit the system or try again.
The user's score must be kept as local data within the Space Fractions system so that the results may be given at the end of the Space Fractions system.
The Space Fractions system will run on any Internet-accessible computer with a web browser that supports
The following table summarizes the external interface requirements for the Space Fractions system.

If a click is detected, the movie is immediately terminated, and the system transitions the user to the game's main menu, bypassing the rest of the movie. If no click is registered, the movie plays in its entirety, after which the Space Fractions system automatically proceeds to the main menu.
The output from this component consists of plot-based questions that incorporate fractions, tailored to both challenge the player's mathematical skills and advance the game's narrative.
The ending scene serves as the culmination of the player's journey through the system, providing a conclusion to the storyline that reflects their performance across critical decision points.
This conclusion reflects the outcomes of key decisions made during the system, specifically at critical junctures that were influenced by the player's understanding and application of fractions.
The tool then performs a validation check on the submitted data to ensure completeness and contextual relevance to the game's educational objectives.
Each link corresponds to a different S2S project, allowing players to choose which external resources they wish to explore based on their interests or areas where they seek further understanding.
This ensures a smooth transition from the system to the external educational content, without disrupting the user's engagement or learning experience.
Only one person can use a single instance of the Space Fractions system.
Maintainability is a primary goal for this project.
For example, using appropriate sub- scenes in the main Flash system to split up the code will allow for easy alteration at a later date.
After a complaint is initiated, police initiates the investigation process.
A designated constable from each police station constantly interfaces with the courts.
The solution should send alerts (e.g., email, SMS) to the user if the user chooses to whenever any action has been taken on the alert.

The CCTNS system must keep an unalterable audit trail capable of automatically capturing and storing information about all the actions (create/read/update/delete) that are taken upon the critical entities in the CCTNS system.
The CCTNS system must maintain the audit trail for as long as required, which will be at least for the life of the case to which it refers.

Any access to cases, and all other activities involving the cases and related documents or data should also need to be stored in the audit trail to ensure legal admissibility and to assist in data recovery.

Requirements: to ensure legal admissibility
to assist in data recovery

text: The CCTNS system must allow persistent defaults for data entry where desirable.
These defaults should include: user-definable values; values same as previous item; values derived from context, e.g.date, file reference, user identifier;
Content accessibility WCAG 1.0 shall be the standard used for guidance on content accessibility.
This may be done by placing important information at the top and providing links to information that is further down the page.

Writing style: The reading and understanding of the textual content on the screen should be supported by suitable means, including the use of short sentences, the division of the text into shorter chunks or the presentation of content items in the form of bullet points.
Distinguishable within-page links: Within-page links should be clearly distinguishable from other links that lead to a different page.

Using descriptive link labels: The target or purpose of a link should be directly indicated by its label, avoiding generic labels such as “go” or “click here” except where the purpose of the link is clear from its context on the page or the labels have commonly understood semantics in the particular application domain.
Marking links opening new windows: Links that open new browser windows or pop-up windows should be clearly marked.

Providing printable document versions: If a document is either too long, dispersed over several pages or in a specific layout that is not suitable for online reading, a printer-friendly version of the document should be provided that prints the content in a form acceptable to the user (e.g.
space filled only with the background color should be used in such a way that it does not impair the visual skimming of the page.
When frames are used, it is important to title each frame, and to describe its purpose and how frames relate to one another other.

Providing alternative text-only pages: When style sheets and/or frames are turned off it should be possible for the user to read and understand the page; alternatively, the user should be provided with an equivalent alternative text-only page.
The International Standards mentioned below shall be consulted for guidance.
Appropriate content presentation also plays a key role in accessibility.
Linking back to the home page or landmark pages: Each page should contain a link leading to the home page of the application or to a landmark page that is easy to recognize for the user.

Requirements: is easy to recognize

text: individualization designing content and navigation differently for varying user groups or roles i.e.

The CCTNS system must be able to retrieve and display within 5-8 seconds the case which has been accessed within the previous 2 months, regardless of storage capacity or number of cases in the CCTNS system.

Requirements: to retrieve and display within 5-8 seconds the case

requirements constraints: to retrieve and display within 5-8 seconds the case

text: The CCTNS system should ensure high standards of security and access control through preventing cross-site scripting.

Requirements: ensure high standards of security and access control

requirements constraints: ensure high standards of security and access control

text: This translation interface will be called the Virtual Correlator Interface.
These individuals will be responsible for performing corrective and preventive maintenance along with periodic performance tests and upgrades.
Network switches shall be employed to distribute traffic within a correlator rack and where their use will significantly reduce overall network wiring complexity.

Network routers/switches shall be employed at the Master Correlator Control Computer-VLA Expansion Project Monitor and Control System interface level to protect the Master Correlator Control Computer from unauthorized access and irrelevant network traffic.

Machine Domain: the Master Correlator Control Computer-VLA Expansion Project Monitor and Control System
Requirements: to protect the Master Correlator Control Computer from unauthorized access

interface: the Master Correlator Control Computer-VLA Expansion Project Monitor and Control System
the Master Correlator Control Computer-VLA Expansion Project Monitor and Control System
requirements reference: the Master Correlator Control Computer-VLA Expansion Project Monitor and Control System
to protect the Master Correlator Control Computer from unauthorized access

text: All system error and debug messages shall be categorized in a logical fashion such that message traffic can be filtered as to content, detail, and message rate.

The hardware part of the EVLA Correlator Monitor and Control System shall be able to perform indefinitely without complete loss of service, except in the event of total failure of primary and backup power.

Machine Domain: the EVLA Correlator Monitor and Control System

text: All systems and application source code shall be available to or on the EVLA Correlator Monitor and Control Systems that execute it.
Transparency shall be accomplished in manner that is transparent to processing, communications and I/O software functions with the possible exception of recompilation of executables.
The Tactical Control System will be connected with Common Operational Modeling, Planning, and Simulation Strategy (COMPASS)
The Tactical Control System will be connected with Tactical Exploitation Systeme (TES)
The Tactical Control System will be connected with Theater Battle Management Core System (TBMCS)
All Tactical Control System HWCI’s and CSCI’s shall be Year 2000 compliant.
The Tactical Control System shall provide software capabilities and hardware configurations necessary to fulfill the operational tasking requirements across the 5 levels of interaction.

Requirements: to fulfill the operational tasking requirements

interface: to fulfill the operational tasking requirements

text: When the Tactical Control System software is halted due to an unplanned power interruption as well as abnormal program termination, then the Tactical Control System shall enter the Recovery Startup Mode upon application of power.

When executing in the Normal Startup Mode, the Tactical Control System shall provide the system functionality necessary to initialize the system to place it in the Operations State within 60 seconds from the time power is supplied and the Tactical Control System application is launched.

Requirements: to initialize the system

text: In the Normal Operations Mode the Tactical Control System shall support payload product management.

Requirements: support payload product management

text: The Tactical Control System shall facilitate automated processing of mission plan data received via C4I interfaces in order to extract the appropriate mission planning data.
The Tactical Control System shall have the functionality to receive and process UAV mission plans from other Tactical Control Systems.

Upon completion of radar cross section analysis and characterization by the Government for each UAV type, Tactical Control System shall utilize a UAV signature versus threat lookup table (database) that identities the lethality of the threat to the UAV [SSS065], and shall provide the capability of displaying aircraft signature versus threat, before and during flight.
The LOL delay is the time from when the AV detects an unplanned LOL to the time it initiates LOL procedures.
The Tactical Control System flight route planner will perform fuel calculations.

Physical Device: The Tactical Control System flight route planner
Requirements: perform fuel calculations

requirements reference: The Tactical Control System flight route planner

text: The Tactical Control System flight route planner will provide terrain avoidance warnings for line-of-sight flights.

Machine Domain: The Tactical Control System flight route planner

interface: The Tactical Control System flight route planner

text: The Tactical Control System shall analyze the flight route plan selected for uplink to determine that the flight constraints of the AV and the limitation of the data link are not violated prior to transmission of the flight route plan to the AV.

Shared Phenomena: the limitation of the data link

interface: the limitation of the data link
the limitation of the data link

text: A de-clutter capability shall be provided that allows the operator to display only a selected number of the most significant threats.
Tactical Control System shall notify the operator when AV performance parameters are out of limits.

Requirements: notify the operator when AV performance parameters are out of limits

requirements reference: notify the operator when AV performance parameters are out of limits
notify the operator when AV performance parameters are out of limits

requirements reference: control the flight of the selected AV in accordance with the specific

text: The Tactical Control System shall provide the capability to enter AV preset limits which, as a minimum, will include airspeed limits, altitude limits, and fuel limits.

Requirements: enter AV preset limits which, as a minimum, will include airspeed limits, altitude limits, and fuel limits

requirements reference: enter AV preset limits which, as a minimum, will include airspeed limits, altitude limits, and fuel limits

text: The Tactical Control System shall allow the operator to control an AV using the LOS as well as SATCOM data links.

allow the operator to control an AV using the LOS as well as SATCOM data links

text: The Tactical Control System shall provide the capability to implement an emergency action plan, if supported by the AV, to control the AV during equipment failures.

Requirements: implement an emergency action plan, if supported by the AV, to control the AV during equipment failures

requirements reference: implement an emergency action plan, if supported by the AV, to control the AV during equipment failures

text: The operator shall have the capability to initiate as well as change, to include as a minimum manual override, flight behaviors by sending the proper control commands to the UAV.
The Tactical Control System shall provide the functionality to control, monitor, and display the operation of the Air Data

Requirements: control, monitor, and display the operation of the Air Data

requirements reference: control, monitor, and display the operation of the Air Data

text: The Tactical Control System shall compute the estimated position of the AV during Loss of Link (LOL) based upon the last known AV position and anticipated flight path based on current flight mode (e.g. flight route plan mode, emergency flight route plan mode, maintain current heading mode).

Requirements: compute the estimated position of the AV during Loss of Link (LOL) based upon the last known AV position and anticipated flight path based on current flight mode (e.g. flight route plan mode, emergency flight route plan mode, maintain current heading mode)

text: The operator shall be able to manually override any automatic data terminal control mode selection if desired, except during Emission Control (EMCON) and Hazards of Electromagnetic Radiation to Ordnance (HERO) conditions.
The Tactical Control System shall be able to store up to 24 hours of payload data.

Requirements: store up to 24 hours of payload data

requirements reference: store up to 24 hours of payload data

text: The Tactical Control System shall be in compliance with Common Imagery Ground Surface Station (CIGSS), United States Imagery Standards (USIS), Video Working Group Standards Architecture, National Imagery Transmission Format (NITF) Version 2.0, and Global Command Control Systems (GCCS) when processing payload imagery data.
The NITF 2.0 imagery files generated by the Tactical Control System shall contain the necessary telemetry and support data to permit subsequent imagery exploitation by C4I systems.

The Tactical Control System shall have the capability to display Near-Real Time (NRT) imagery to include, as a minimum, date/time group, target location coordinates when the target is in the center of the field of view, north seeking arrow, and AV position and heading.

Requirements: to display Near-Real Time (NRT) imagery
date/time group
target location coordinates
north seeking arrow
AV position and heading

text: The Tactical Control System shall have the functionality to determine the location of items of interest within the payload field of view, and express these locations in coordinates acceptable for military applications.

Requirements: to determine the location of items of interest
express these locations in coordinates acceptable for military applications

text: The Tactical Control System shall plan and conduct a mission.

Requirements: plan and conduct a mission

text: The Tactical Control System shall allow an Authorized Operator to execute a software debug capability and view the resulting debug diagnostic information.

Requirements: allow an Authorized Operator to execute a software debug capability
view the resulting debug diagnostic information

text: The Tactical Control System core software shall be generically written to provide level one through level five interaction for both Outrider and Predator UAVs and establish the architecture for future tactical UAVs.

Machine Domain: The Tactical Control System core software
Requirements: to provide level one through level five interaction for both Outrider and Predator UAVs
establish the architecture for future tactical UAVs
Shared Phenomena: provide level one through level five interaction

interface: The Tactical Control System core software
provide level one through level five interaction

text: The Tactical Control System software shall be non-proprietary and have unlimited data rights.

Requirements: non-proprietary and have unlimited data rights

text: All Tactical Control System warning messages and HCI actions shall be archived for later review.

Machine Domain: All Tactical Control System warning messages
Requirements: archived for later review

text: The HCI shall provide redundancy in all operations, so that the loss of any one HCI input device does not prohibit operation of any Tactical Control System function.
The Tactical Control System HCI shall provide the capability to select and amplify an object and point on a map as well as payload screen.

Requirements: to select and amplify an object and point on a map as well as payload screen

text: The Tactical Control System HCI shall display the SAR imaging swath on the map display.

Requirements: display the SAR imaging swath on the map display
Shared Phenomena: display the SAR imaging swath on the map display

interface: display the SAR imaging swath on the map display

text: [SSS479] The Tactical Control System HCI shall provide the on-screen capability to select and efficiently move as well as reorient a previously defined SAR imaging swath.

Requirements: the on-screen capability
to select and efficiently move as well as reorient a previously defined SAR imaging swath

text: The Center-to-Center infrastructure must interconnect several dissimilar traffic management systems.
The Center-to-Center infrastructure is being created using a series of building blocks.
These building blocks allow the software to be utilized in a number of configurations (by simply altering the configuration parameters of the software).

Requirements: be utilized in a number of configurations

requirements reference: be utilized in a number of configurations

text: The mnemonic for the Center-to-Center project is Center-to-Center.
For each roadway network it maintains, the Center shall provide the network name and link data information.
The Center shall support the following status information about each Traffic Signal, including network identifier,traffic signal identifier, traffic signal name,location and status.

The Center shall support the following status information about each Railroad Crossing, including network identifier, link identifier, rail crossing identifier, rail crossing name, location and status.
The Center shall support the following status information about each Bus Stop, including network identifier, link identifier, relative link location, name and location.
DATEX/ASN shall be used to transmit the TMDD message sets.
The Web Map application generates a map that can be displayed on an Internet WWW server.
The map user shall be able to alter the current magnification (zoom level) of the map.
The GUI shall allow the data about an incident to be modified.

Shared Phenomena: the data about an incident to be modified

interface: the data about an incident to be modified

text: The GUI shall allow a user to delete a previously entered lane closure.

Shared Phenomena: delete a previously entered lane closure

interface: delete a previously entered lane closure
delete a previously entered lane closure

text: The Center-to-Center Server shall execute in a Microsoft Windows NT environment.
The Center-to-Center web interface shall be implemented using C/C++ and ESRI ARC IMS.
The Remote Control GUI shall be implemented using C/C++ and ESRI Map Objects.
The Center-to-Center shall be able to operate in normal mode.
